bestBHT.bht: The disciples' inability to cast out the unclean spirit highlighted both the severity of the disease and their own weakness. This incident caused skepticism and accusations among some who questioned why the disciples, who possessed the power over unclean spirits, were unsuccessful in this instance. However, it is worth noting that the child's father also demonstrated a lack of faith, pleading, if thou canst do anything, help us. Jesus used this opportunity to emphasize the significance of faith, with the father admitting his need for the Lord's help in overcoming his unbelief.

Philip Schaff: Matthew 17:16. Thy disciples. Including the nine Apostles.
John Gill: This he said, partly to show the malignity and stubbornness of the disease, and partly to accuse the disciples of weakness.

Here the Jew insults, and charges with contradiction, that in one place it should be said, that Jesus gave his disciples power to cast out unclean spirits, and here all the disciples could not cast a spirit out of one little child: but without any reason.

It is clear from Mark, that when he came to Christ, he had but little faith; he says to him, 'if thou canst do anything, help us'; and after Christ had talked with him about his faith, he could only say, 'Lord, I believe, help mine unbelief'.

In response, Jesus emphasized the importance of faith, with the father acknowledging his need for the Lord's assistance in his unbelief.
